benchmark_details.name: IMPLIRET (Implicit Fact Retrieval Challenge)
benchmark_details.overview: IMPLIRET introduces a benchmark for evaluating retrieval models when relevance depends on document-side reasoning on implicit facts. It focuses on reasoning categories such as world knowledge, arithmetic, and temporal.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate retrieval systems on their ability to retrieve relevant documents based on implicit knowledge rather than surface-level matching.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: While carefully designed, IMPLIRET data may differ slightly from naturally occurring text in discourse structure or topic diversity.

data.source: Synthetically generated using LLMs and structured templates.
data.annotation: Automatically generated and semi-automated with human verification.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on retrieval performance against implicit queries.
methodology.interpretation: Higher nDCG@10 and ROUGE-1 recall indicate better performance in retrieving relevant documents.
methodology.baseline_results: The best nDCG@10 achieved was 14.91% using dense retrieval methods.
methodology.validation: Validation includes sanity checks on fluency and implicit support for the queried facts.
